title: epi2me-labs/wf-clone-validation
description: De novo assemble plasmid sequences from Oxford Nanopore data.

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

fastq.description: Directory containing fastq input files. May contain fastq files directly or directories name barcodeXX relating to independent samples.
fastq.help_text: If directories named "barcode*" are found under the `--fastq` directory the data is assumed to be multiplex and each barcode directory will be processed independently. If `.fastq(.gz)` files are found under the `--fastq` directory the sample is assumed to not be multiplexed. In this second case `--samples` should be a simple name rather than a CSV file.

sample.description: A sample name for non-multiplexed data. Permissible if passing a file or directory of .fastq(.gz).

sample_sheet.description: CSV file with columns named `barcode`, `sample_id` and optionally `type`, `approx_size`. Permissible if passing a directory containing barcodeXX sub-directories.

out_dir.description: Directory for output of all user-facing files.

primers.description: File containing primers or null if you want to turn off

sanitize_fastq.description: Use additional heuristics to identify barcodes from file paths.
sanitize_fastq.help_text: Enabling this option will group together files into samples by the presence of strings of the form `barcodeXXX` present in filenames, rather than simply files grouped into directories (as output by MinKNOW and the Guppy basecaller).

reference_genome_options.title: Reference genome options
reference_genome_options.description: Reference genome related files and options required for the workflow.

reference.description: Optional file containing reference sequence to align inserts with.

db_directory.description: Directory where the annotation database is stored. A generic annotation database can be obtained with the following two commands: 1. wget https://ont-exd-int-s3-euwst1-epi2me-labs.s3.amazonaws.com/wf-clone-validation/wf-clone-validation-db.tar.gz 2. tar -xzvf wf-clone-validation-db.tar.gz  This will create a directory `wf-clone-validation` in the current working directory which can be provided as the `--db_directory` parameter.

host_reference.description: FASTA file, reads which map to it are discarded.

meta_data.title: Meta data
meta_data.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
meta_data.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

prefix.description: The prefix attached to each of the output filenames.

disable_ping.description: Enable to prevent sending a workflow ping.

assm_coverage.description: Use this many fold coverage per assembly

approx_size.description: Approximate size of the plasmid in base pairs, can also be defined per sample see approx_size_sheet param

approx_size_sheet.description: Approximate size of each plasmid in format sample_id,approx_size

regions_bedfile.description: BED file, mask regions within host_reference from filtering.

canu_useGrid.description: Turn on canu use grid option.

trim_length.description: Number of base pairs to trim from the read ends

fast.description: Fast option can make the assembly step significantly faster. It can be used on any genome size but may produce less continuous assemblies on genomes larger than 1 Gbp.

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.

threads.description: Max number of threads to use for each process.

docs.intro:
## Introduction

This repository contains a nextflow workflow that can be used to de novo assemble plasmid sequences from Oxford Nanopore data.
